meanings.definition: One tenth of annual produce or earnings, formerly taken as a tax for the support of the church and clergy.
meanings.sent1: The farmer donated tithes of his crops to the church.
meanings.sent2: In the past, people would give tithes to support the clergy.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to save tithes of its acorns for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The river generously shared tithes of its water with the thirsty land.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays seemed to give tithes of light to the dark forest.

meanings.definition: To pay or give a tenth part of (one's income, property, etc.) as a tax or contribution to the church.
meanings.sent1: She tithes a portion of her salary to her local church every month.
meanings.sent2: Many believers choose to tithe regularly to support their religious community.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully pretends to tithe its toys to the imaginary church of mice.
meanings.sent4: The wind seems to tithe whispers of secrets to the rustling leaves.
meanings.sent5: The candle flame flickered as if tithing warmth to the chilly room.
